title: STOP FIRST PICKING AD MIDS IN SOLO Q PLEASEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
body: It puts your team in SUCH a bad spot. Most people don't know AP champs in Top or Jungle. I know it makes you look so cool to play Zed and Yasuo because they ninjas and samurais m8 but fuckin m8 I swear to god. If you HAVE to chop people up with shadows and wind stuff ASK YOUR TEAM FIRST IF THEY KNOW AND ARE WILLING TO PLAY AP CHAMPS.

replies.body:
Everyone should pick whatever they are most comfortable with, better he picks Zed into a full AD team composition and carries, than picks Orianna and feeds. There are also plenty of AD scaling picks that are actually more AP than you think;

Udyr (Phoenix build + optional devourer)
Shyvanna (optional devourer)
Shen
Volibear
Sion
Rammus
Skarner?
+ any auto attack champion with devourer e.g Master Yi, AD Fizz...

I'm sure you can play at least one of those.

Yes, of course there's the comfortability point and it is a strong one, I can't argue with that. I just wish people who play mid would get familiar with at least one or two good AP mids for first picking reasons, it makes it easier in Solo Q where no one communicates and no one listens to you.

um bud if you get a {{item:3035}} and {{item:3071}} then it don't mater how much armor they got your gona shred them and that's if they pick any tanks most of the time now there's no tank or they are a tank but go ad tank hybrid which gives the about 150 armor and 50 mr if you got no ap champs with a last wisher takes there armor to about 70 which is normal so don't go and tell people what to play I see so many games were they say ow tanks are to op cant damage them if you build armor pen then they go from tanks to doing 100 damage and being unkillabal to 0 damage and 0 hp cos you just burst that ass like a fed{{champion:75}} with 1k on his q and tp in with homegards and 1 shot your adc

wat

I couldn't understand that entire post.
then your a fool who cant read it ses got armor pen and you will be able to win a game with a full ad team
lol english pls

> [{quoted}](name=Olee,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=PF254q11,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-26T14:47:47.663+0000)
>
> lol english pls

He has trouble, he might be half illiterate (dysplasia or something)

Anyway what he is trying to say that if you get LS or cleaver you set ad tank hybrids to square one and hurt the effectiveness of full tanks (which you wouldn't be trying to kill anyway). Apparently you deal damage like a fed nasus to squshies who don't get peel from the tanks you are trashing

So we have to pick into what you want, not what we want?

Good thinking there OP - person X wants to play AD mid and you don't want to play AP top or jungle - so person X has to play AP mid so you can play something besides AP top or Jungle.

I never ever ever ever ever ever ever ever said I didn't want to play AP champs in other roles. I'm saying other people don't even KNOW AP champs in other roles. When I don't get mid, I play support and when that's gone, I go top, where I do know some AP champs, but most of which are tanks who don't do enough damage to matter, and most of the time, I HAVE to play a tank because our jungler went Yi and my support went Soraka. 

If you must pick an AD mid, do so, but it just puts you, and your team in a bad spot. Mid lane has always been the predominant "AP" lane. The most popular junglers (except for last patch) and top laners in the past have been physical damage champions so it has always been expected that the mid laner would pick a magic damage type champion. Especially in this new patch, with everyone playing Garen, Skarner, Shyvana, Renekton, Darius and items like Dead Man's plate, Sterak' Gage and so on and so on son

Ah ok. Yeah I know the feels, I hate playing AP tops.

AD Mids are actually really good right now with the nerfs to armor and increased cost.

Also you don't have to run tanks in your team comp, won many a game with no tanks.

Yeah, there's definitely been an AD mid resurgence, I too love playing AD mids from time to time. 

And no you don't HAVE to, but in Solo Q where everyone has to make their own decisions and there isn't much communication happening, a front line makes everything just a little easier.

> [{quoted}](name=Olee,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=PF254q11,comment-id=0008000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-26T07:31:46.377+0000)
>
> Yeah, there's definitely been an AD mid resurgence, I too love playing AD mids from time to time. 
> 
> And no you don't HAVE to, but in Solo Q where everyone has to make their own decisions and there isn't much communication happening, a front line makes everything just a little easier.

I'm not sure about ad tank itemizeation but Evelyn always deals high amounts of magic damage even if you build her AD (all her abilities deal magic damage regardless of what you build her) so if you don't feel comfortable playing traditional ap jglers you can go her or Kayle with devourer (same scenario with itemization)

step 1: play yasuo.
step 2: be good unlike the other trash yasuo.
step 3: carry because your actually good with yasuo

Question: AD Mids don't pick?
Answer: Hell yes pick yasuo, his ult is 50% pen, then buy a last whisper for free true damage (35% pen + 50% of their %, no armor for  5 days(1 day being 2 sec))

Yasuo definitely has lots of carry potential. Also, you have to remember, that Yasuo's ult pen, only appears AFTER he ults AND it's only to BONUS armour. Runes, Masteries, Items etc. But if you're a really good Yasuo and can carry a full ad comp every game, be my guest.
you are*

i agree with you but if its such a big deal for you maybe you can play an ap heavy champ in another role. strong meta picks right now include rumble at top, nidalee and elise in jungle, annie or a few others for support. even corki, kog and blue ez for adc would be a great cover for an ad mid
no, elise died
No way. That nerf was nowhere near enough to stop her from being strong.
or ad crit mord in the bot lane as adc doing 1k crits which is ad damage activate q to do 1200 ap damage with just 200 ad try to build to stop that I dare you

And why is it you shouldn't just get used to playing AP top's and Jungles?

I agree these guys are annoying, but it happens, and when it does i have my Sejuani/Maokai, who get to deal a crapload of damage for a tank because the enemy will only build armor.
not to say any think but go ad crit mord do 1k ad crits with basic attacks with just 200 ad you will do 1200 ap damage on 3erd hit its op doing both ad and ap damage
I try man, I try. I'm also gonna start practicing some AP champs in other roles.
Just as a note, you need to have CARRY ap champs for top and jungle, or at least one's that can deal substantial amounts of damage.
That's what I meant by the champs I was gonna practice. I am fully aware of that

Or black cleaver, that is a thing.

Honestly a full AD comp can still be competitive, probably better than having someone who doesn't know how to play/doesn't want to play a mage. 

Full AD comps have a competitive edge early and should try and press it for a strong mid game to end the game before 6 items occurs and the enemy gains either a damage advantage or extra defense with the optimized slots. Falling behind as an AD comp is brutal, that however is not a fault of the composition rather it's execution.

While Armour stacking is strong against such a composition the black cleaver synergy gained from the teams damage sealers can counteract this, grabbing in on frontlines can really amp the damage of the entire team.

Yo I told my team maybe 79 times to build Black Cleavers and Last Whispers. "This is the guide that MobaFire told me to do fuck you".

I understand all this. AD Mids also very heavily outrade most AP mids. But all of that, all of what you said, doesn't work in Silver Solo Q man.
If it's a full AD comp then build it yourself. It's a pretty sound item on anyone AD related.

The most recent game where that happened to me, I picked Maokai top to try and get SOME magic damage so Cleaver really wouldn't have helped. And of course I'd build it I was on a champion that suited the build.

Well then it wasn't a full AD comp, all or nothing!

Even on Moakai it's an alright item. It gives CDR and health and makes him surprisingly mobile (position that Vengeful Maelstrom!). If your team complains about it point out it amps their damage.

Still though, when MOST of your damage comes from a Vi, Yasuo and a I think it was a Jinx? A Maokai isn't gonna make a difference if they enemy team has a fucktonne of armour. Black Cleaver is MAYBE viable on Maokai, but he needs Mana. He needs lots and lots of mana, which Cleaver gives none of. 

I never said it was a full AD comp xD Just the mid laner
If it's not full AD then what's the problem? You have magic damage!
Not enough to sway the enemy into building MR.

Just as a note, since the last patch having a full AD team is basically suicide if the game goes on long enough.

Thornmail now has armor scaling
Randuin's Negate's crits
Thing's like Deadman's plate, and Titanic Hydra now make tanks damage scale decently.
Thing's like Frozen heart and Armor boot's still exist (for auto focused AD)
Ad mids are fine situationally. But my preference is to always mix up the ap / ad so that late game the enemy cant stack armour to win
AP SHACO TOP ILLUMINATI ARMY IS HERE

You CAN pick AD mids in solo queue. If the jg, top and/or bot picks an AP champ. But who the hell goes fiddle jungle unless the support and top agree to take a tank first?

AP beats AD when your team is balanced. MR is harder to itemize than Armour and AP kills carries who don't build defenses while AD kills tanks who build defenses but fail to stay under fire for too long.
